definition: to leave the rails/to derail/to jump the track
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
course/path/track/rail

sentences.english: Regularly checked rail lines, but derailments without apparent cause.
sentences.chinese: 定期接受檢查的鐵路線，但是卻無緣無故地脫軌。

sentences.english: But in fact, most promotions derail you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，事實上，大部分晉升會讓你”脫軌“。

sentences.english: As the word of Sherry, I am a farmer now. I have disengaged with era completely.
sentences.chinese: 用王總的話，我現在就一農民，完全和時代脫軌了。

sentences.english: In the past, we very long time Beijing is building with the international derailment.
sentences.chinese: 過去我們很長一段時間北京的建設是跟國際上脫軌的。

sentences.english: Rich-country emission cuts dangerously off course.
sentences.chinese: 富裕國家的減排計劃嚴重脫軌。

sentences.english: Most of the dead and injured were in three carriages which were derailed and overturned.
sentences.chinese: 大部分傷亡乘客是在三節脫軌，翻過來的車廂裏。

sentences.english: The 'run-away' train is finally applying its brakes !
sentences.chinese: 脫軌的列車最終會剎車的。

sentences.english: So the last bogies of Kamayani Express got derailed.
sentences.chinese: 因此，卡馬亞尼快車的最後一個轉向架脫軌。

definition: to crash (into another car)/(fig.) (of opinions, schedules etc) to clash/(of subject matter) to be the same
to no avail/of no use
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
excess load/an overload/overloaded
a common occurrence (idiom)
mortal wound/(fig.) fatal weakness/Achilles' heel
fast lane
out of order (of machine)/not working properly/a failing (of a system)
socialization/to socialize/to fit into society/to train sb for society
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
to change buses, trains etc
to reverse (a vehicle)/to drive backwards
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
